Package net.jdazher.domain.tasks.model

Class Task

java.lang.Object
net.jdazher.domain.tasks.model.Task
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class Task extends Object implements Serializable
A class that represents a task in the system. Each task has a title, description, due date, status, and a list of associated tags. The task can be created, updated, and tracked for its status and due date.

This class is immutable once created, except for the status, which can change during the task lifecycle.

Annotations used:

  • Getter - Generates getter methods for all fields.
  • ToString - Generates a toString method.
  • EqualsAndHashCode - Generates equals and hashCode methods.
  • NoArgsConstructor - Generates a no-argument constructor for the class.

This class implements Serializable to allow it to be serialized.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Task

      public Task(String title, String description, LocalDateTime dueDate, List<TaskTag> tags) throws IllegalDateException
      Constructor to create a Task with a title, description, due date, and tags. The task is assigned a unique ID, and its status is set to TaskStatus.CREATED.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the task.
      description - The description of the task.
      dueDate - The due date of the task. Cannot be in the past or too far in the future.
      tags - A list of TaskTag associated with the task.
      Throws:
      IllegalDateException - if the due date is in the past or more than a year in the future.

    • Task

      public Task(String title, String description, LocalDateTime dueDate) throws IllegalDateException
      Constructor to create a Task with a title, description, and due date without tags. The task is assigned a unique ID, and its status is set to TaskStatus.CREATED.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the task.
      description - The description of the task.
      dueDate - The due date of the task. Cannot be in the past or too far in the future.
      Throws:
      IllegalDateException - if the due date is in the past or more than a year in the future.

    • Task

      public Task(UUID id, String title, String description, LocalDateTime dueDate, TaskStatus status, List<TaskTag> tags) throws IllegalDateException
      Constructor to create a Task with an existing ID, title, description, due date, status, and tags.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the task.
      title - The title of the task.
      description - The description of the task.
      dueDate - The due date of the task. Cannot be in the past or too far in the future.
      status - The current status of the task.
      tags - A list of TaskTag associated with the task.
      Throws:
      IllegalDateException - if the due date is in the past or more than a year in the future.

  • Method Details

    • changeStatus

      public void changeStatus(TaskStatus status)
      Changes the status of the task to the provided status.
      Parameters:
      status - The new TaskStatus to set.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the task is already in DUE, COMPLETED, or CANCELLED status, or if the new status is CREATED.

    • checkInitialDueDate

      public boolean checkInitialDueDate(LocalDateTime dueDate) throws IllegalDateException
      Checks if the due date is valid. The due date must not be in the past or more than a year in the future.
      Parameters:
      dueDate - The due date to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the due date is valid.
      Throws:
      IllegalDateException - if the due date is invalid (in the past or too far in the future).

    • checkIfTaskIsDue

      public boolean checkIfTaskIsDue()
      Checks if the task is due based on its status and due date.
      Returns:
      true if the task is due, otherwise false.
